Intructions.val: The ACALL instruction calls a subroutine located at the specified address. (ACALL LABEL)
he ADD instruction adds a byte value to the accumulator and stores the results back in the accumulator.(ADD A, @R1)
The ADDC instruction adds a byte value and the value of the carry flag to the accumulator(ADDC A, @R0)
The AJMP instruction transfers program execution to the specified address(AJMP LABEL)
The ANL instruction performs a bitwise logical AND operation between the specified byte or bit operands and stores the result in the destination operand(ANL A, @R0)
The CJNE instruction compares the first two operands and branches to the specified destination if their values are not equal(CJNE @R1, #24H, LABEL)
The CLR instruction sets the specified destination operand to a value of 0(CLR A)
The CPL instruction logically complements the value of the specified destination operand and stores the result back in the destination operand(CPL A)
The DA instruction adjusts the eight-bit value in the Accumulator resulting from the earlier addition of two variables(DA A)
The DEC instruction decrements the specified operand by 1(DEC @R1)
The DIV instuction divides the unsigned 8-bit integer in the accumulator by the unsigned 8-bit integer in register B(DIV AB)
The DJNZ instruction decrements the byte indicated by the first operand and, if the resulting value is not zero, branches to the address specified in the second operand(DJNZ 40h, LABEL)
The INC instruction increments the specified operand by 1(INC @R0)
The JB instruction branches to the address specified in the second operand if the value of the bit specified in the first operand is 1(JB P1.2 LABEL)
The JBC instruction branches to the address specified in the second operand if the value of the bit specified in the first operand is 1(JBC 44h)
The JC instruction branches to the specified address if the carry flag is set(JC LABEL)
The JMP instruction transfers execution to the address generated by adding the 8-bit value in the accumulator to the 16-bit value in the DPTR register(JMP @A+DPTR)
The JNB instruction branches to the specified address if the specified bit operand has a value of 0(JNB P1.3, LABEL)
The JNC instruction transfers program control to the specified address if the carry flag is 0(JNC LABEL)
The JNZ instruction transfers control to the specified address if the value in the accumulator is not 0(JNZ LABEL)
The JZ instruction transfers control to the specified address if the value in the accumulator is 0(JZ LABEL)
The LCALL instruction calls a subroutine located at the specified address(LCALL SUB1)
The LJMP instruction transfers program execution to the specified 16-bit address(LJMP LABEL)
The MOV instruction moves data bytes between the two specified operands(MOV @R0, #0)
The MOVC instruction moves a byte from the code or program memory to the accumulator(MOVC A, @A+DPTR)
The MOVX instruction transfers data between the accumulator and external data memory(MOVX @R0, A)
The MUL instruction multiplies the unsigned 8-bit integer in the accumulator and the unsigned 8-bit integer in the B register producing a 16-bit product(MUL AB)
The NOP instruction does no operation(NOP)
The ORL instruction performs a bitwise logical OR operation on the specified operands, the result of which is stored in the destination operand(ORL A, #01h)
The POP instruction reads a byte from the address indirectly referenced by the SP register(POP 34h)
The PUSH instruction increments the stack pointer and stores the value of the specified byte operand at the internal RAM address indirectly referenced by the stack pointer(PUSH A)
The RET instruction pops the high-order and low-order bytes of the PC from the stack (and decrements the stack pointer by 2)(RET)
The RETI instruction is used to end an interrupt service routine(RETI)
The RL instruction rotates the eight bits in the accumulator left one bit position(RL A)
The RLC instruction rotates the eight bits in the accumulator and the one bit in the carry flag left one bit position(RLC A)
The RR instruction rotates the eight bits in the accumulator right one bit position(RR A)
The RRC instruction rotates the eight bits in the accumulator and the one bit in the carry flag right one bit position(RRC A)
The SETB instruction sets the bit operand to a value of 1(SETB 63h)
The SJMP instruction transfers execution to the specified address(SJMP LABEL)
The SUBB instruction subtracts the specified byte variable and the carry flag from the accumulator(SUBB A, #01h)
The SWAP instruction exchanges the low-order and high-order nibbles within the accumulator(SWAP A)
The XCH instruction loads the accumulator with the byte value of the specified operand while simultaneously storing the previous contents of the accumulator in the specified operand(XCH A, @R0)
The XCHD instruction exchanges the low-order nibble of the accumulator with the low-order nibble of the specified internal RAM location(XCHD A, @R1)
The XRL instruction performs a logical exclusive OR operation between the specified operands(XRL A, #0FFh)
